author: Evgeniy Sereda
title: Charles Hoskinson in Russian
description: There is low penetration of Cardano philosophy and vision in non-English speaking countries, that constitute 83% of world population.

assessments.note: Charles is a motivator for many people, so having him understood by a non-English speaking population could prove beneficial for the Cardano community. As another member of Catalyst community asked in one of the comments, I'm not sure how much more effective dubbing is over having subtitles.

The problem statement is subjective, it would be important to add data to support the statement.

The statement used to support the problem: "But there are no active YouTube channels about Cardano in other languages" is not true, this is easily verified by doing research about Cardano in different languages.

Although the arguments are not credible, there really is a problem with the language barrier that needs to be addressed, which is how.

The solution described in the proposal does not address the challenge in a relevant way, as it doesn't establish a clear method of improving value onboarding for Catalyst, being a proposal for wide dissemination in the Russian community but with no indication of how it will result in results for Catalyst and the items established in the Challenge Brief.

Another great aspect to be considered is that videos on Youtube already have the option of automatic translated subtitles, this aspect greatly reduces the potential of the proposal.

This may be a good idea. Not clear it focuses on the goal of encouraging more meaningful participation from the community. It seems more likely to be aimed at bringing in more Russians to the community.

I see this initiative as a good way to onboard the Russian population and increase Cardano's visibility there. Although, not all videos made by Charles are Catalyst related, and the main topic of the challenge in Catalyst onboarding. It would be better to focus on content related to Catalyst, and in this way the proposal would be very aligned to the challenge goals.

The proposer has created a demo for about 2 minutes of one of Charles' videos. I cannot say how well it was translated, but on the quality side, I think for a demo it was quite good. Splitting his proposal over several funding rounds is a good idea, having a smaller objective of translating only 25 hours at first, shows that he's quite serious about the proposal getting done.

There is no information about the proposer's experience and qualifications, just a 2-minute video translated, which I consider insufficient to demonstrate the proposer's ability to execute the proposal. What is the proposer's ability to translate and dub content? This is not clear.

The plan does not require complexity, it comes down to translating, subtitling and dubbing Charles Hoskinson's videos. The hourly budget is 260 USD. Dubbing costs vary widely according to several factors, but the established value is within the acceptable range. Dubbing costs are much higher than translation and subtitling.

Charles has dozens of hours of recorded video and in most of the videos there are AMAs, which often deal with random subjects and not related to Cardano, in addition to a small part of the videos is related to Catalyst. So I think it's important that there is a definition of what would be translated / dubbed.

The budget is detailed according to the number of hours to be worked.
Not clear the proposer has the capability to do this, though has provided 1 demo (I don't speak Russian so can't comment on accuracy). Is 260 per hour of Russian video translation a fair price?

The demo video is great to exemplify the capabilities of the proposer in achieving the desired goal. The plan in clear and seems to be completely achievable. The budget is also well explained. Everything about feasibility seems fine.

The information provided is realistic and and easy to follow. He knows how to proceed with the translation, he knows the costs and how long it would take. The information is easy to evaluate over the period of three months that he has committed for completion.

There is an objective to fund the translation / subtitling / dubbing of 25 hours of videos over 3 months, but there is no clear and well-structured roadmap indicating the beginning, middle and end. I recommend defining an objective timeline.

There is budget brakdown. There are no metrics that indicate an impact on the challenge. No KPIS. There are no details on the qualification and experience of the proposer.
No clear measure of how it is increasing participation of the community in the next two funds.

The roadmap is simple and clear, and the audience related KPI is also good. It would be even better to track the amount of people who goes into Catalyst based on these videos, since this is the main goal of the challenge. It would also be very simple to audit the proposals since the objective is clear, to dub all CH videos within 3 months.

solution: Translate in Russian Charles Hoskinson's YouTube videos (3 months period) to promote Cardano philosophy to 3% population.
experience: We have recoded demo of translation: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H7H4Cz8YQdg
